title: Can meditation reduce one’s need for food? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, Definitely… I have been meditating for a few days and my crave for food is already decreased. Eating more food results to indigestion. I am eating now a days only once a day or sometimes twice a day…and I don’t feel weak. The scientific reason may could be the decrease in oxidation process in your body…because your mind is calm and it doesn’t need much energy and thus the body also needs less energy. I used to wonder how people in the cave were able to live and meditate so long without eating any food. And here is the answer. Meditation decreases your mental stress, mind work and makes your body still. The just opposite happens when you are exercising and loosing up your energy..The more you work out, the more heavy food you need to sustain your body. Their is increase in breadth rate and their is vigorous oxidation process going on in your body. Similar process to that of meditation happens if you smoke Marijuana regularly. Marijuana is known to be a spiritual booster and it brings the similar effect that of Meditation. Your mind become calm and your body processes slows down a little bit. If you observe, the people who smoke marijuana regularly tends to eat less and thus become slimmer. Hope this answer is satisfactory. I am writing from my experience. Good luck. Meditate and stay blessed.

After actively meditating and learning about it for around 4 years: I don’t think it works like this. Moreover, keep in mind that our bodies need certain amount of nutritions to function properly. However meditation trains your mind, so by gaining mental strength I experienced that I can resist eating junk food and food full of sugar way more easilyI can easily resist overeatingI can easily stick to eating a certain times (I don’t do late-night-snacks anymore)I can handle hunger without getting irritated. Didn’t have time for breakfast? No problem anymore.So meditation can help to develop a mindset for healthy eating an resist stress that comes from temporary hunger.

Meditation can help you become aware of your physical body as well as your emotional state, so that you can bring your mind and body into balance. Meditation allows you to see cravings for what they really are, emotionally charged thoughts.

Meditation is the food of the soul and Hunger for food on the table, comes from the wants of the physical. However, when one is fully fulfilled with the food of angels, satiety does not allow added ingestion of want of the senses!
